general_advisory: In paddy crop, Panicle initiation, Panicle emergence, flowering and milking stages are critical. Cover rows with dry leaves in Sugarcane. Apply sprinkler irrigation to reduce heat effect. High temperature increases maize crop's water requirement. Spread polythene in irrigation channels. Apply Streptocyclin in tomato and brinjal. Mulch coconut leaves to reduce water loss. Cover newly planted vegetable seedlings during the day. Harvest fingerlings in shallow ponds when water temperature rises.

advisory: To manage Yellow Stem Borer, spray Fipronil 5%SC @ 400ml/acre or Flubendiamide 20% WG @ 50g/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 60ml /acre or Chromafenozide 80%WP @ 50g/acre.
To manage blast disease, spray Hexaconazole 5% SC @ 400-ml/acre or Azoxystrobin 18.2% + Difenoconazole 11.4 % S.C @ 200-ml/acre or Tebuconazole 50%+ Trifloxystrobin 25 % WG @ 80-gram/acre.

To manage Tobacco Caterpillar, dust with Chlorpyrifos 1.5 % D @ 10 kg around the field. For chemical control, spray Novaluron 5.25% + Indoxacarb 4.25% @ 400-ml/acre or Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.9 CS @ 300 ml or Flubendiamide 20 % WG @ 120 gram.
To manage early shoot borer, irrigate frequently during hot months. Cut attacked shoot at or just below the ground level. Apply Fipronil 0.3% GR @ 10 kg/acre at first earthing up.

To manage shoot and fruit borer, install pheromone trap. Spray neem-based pesticide or chemical control with Spinosad 45 % SC @ 75-ml/acre or Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 80-gram/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5 % SC @80-ml/acre or Spinetoram 11.7 % SC @ 200-ml /acre.
To prevent whitefly infestation, treat seeds with Imidacloprid @ 7-gram/kg. Install yellow sticky traps.
After harvesting, dry the bulbs in a well-ventilated room for longer storage.
To control mango hoppers, spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 5 ml/15 litre or Thiamethoxam 25% W.G @ 3ml/15litre or Acetamiprid 20% S.P. @ 4g/15litre.
